data.title: Good all around restaurant for breakfast or lunch
data.text: This is a great restaurant in downtown Lynchburg.  They have a great breakfast and lunch menu and is a nice venue.  In the summer time the place can be too hot.  You also have to be careful of crowding on Sunday.  Good food and reasonable prices.

data.title: Above average
data.text:
I have been to Market at Main 3 times now (once for lunch, twice for dinner). The place has a cool atmosphere and my favorite part is that they serve breakfast all day. However, the food is only slightly above average, I've never had anything amazing there. I had high hopes for the Jefferson Street Cinnamon Roll but it was just ok (Not as good as one from Macado's). 
The place is worth a try but it won't knock your socks off.

data.title: Awesome place
data.text: Great atmosphere, awesome service and wonderful food. Expect a short wait at rush time but there is room to stand or sit. Family friendly.

data.title: Love Main Street brunch!!
data.text: Agree with another review..great vibe,food and service!! Definately a must when visiting downtown Lynchburg! Have not been for dinner but will try it at some point!

data.title: Historic atmosphere and great food
data.text: This restaurant has tons of character and plenty of excellent choices. We came for breakfast and loved the food, especially the eggs Benedict and the stuffed French toast. We ordered a cinnamon roll for the table to share; it was gooey and delicious. My husband is a breakfast meat connoisseur and so we were pleased to see the high end options. I do think that it is a bit pricey, more than $80 for six of us to have breakfast.

data.title: Good downtown brunch
data.text: I've been to Market at Main many times, and the food has always been good. Service, as it does most places over a long enough period of time, varies. There's plenty of great places to eat on Main Street in Lynchburg, Market at Main is one of them. It does get pretty busy a lot of the time though.

data.title: Great diner
data.text: Loved the vibe of this place. Busy even at 9.30 on a mid-week morning. Try the "flight of pancakes": the corn cakes were particularly good.

data.title: Nice local old time vibe
data.text: Came to the Market for breakfast after some appointments in town. Never disappointed with the breakfast foods (although have never eaten other meals there). The pancakes are excellent as is the homemade hash. Never disappointed. Service may be slow at times but food is always worth the wait.

data.title: Always busy but worth the wait!!!
data.text:
Love this restaurant!!! Every time we've been, there was a wait but it is soooooo good, we happily wait!!
Food is wonderful! 
I try something different each time and it's always yummy! I've had the bishops burger, a salad with grilled chicken and yesterday tried the homemade meatloaf - ALL delish!!!!
Fried okra is great!

data.title: Amazing Cinnamon Rolls!!!
data.text: So we didn't just get the cinnamon rolls and everything was delicious but the Cinnamon rolls definitely stood out above the rest. Great little place for breakfast!

data.title: Excellent Food/Staff
data.text: We eat at this restaurant every time we are in L'burg.  They are always busy.  This weekend they were even busier than usual - a lot going on in town.  When we got our food, there were a few minor errors.  The manager made sure the errors were fixed immediately and our food was wonderful as usual.  Not only is the food fabulous, but I do feel that on the very few minors occasions we have ever experienced a problem, management works extremely hard to fix it.  I appreciate the wonderful food and wonderful customer service.  If you haven't had a chance to eat there - you are missing out!

data.title: Love this place
data.text: We've been here for breakfast several times & love it.  I'd go back again in a heartbeat.  Friendly atmosphere, great breakfast.  The only issue is that it tends to be pretty loud during peek times.

data.title: Restaurant in Old Store
data.text: This restaurant is in the old Kresge store on Main Street. The tin ceiling remains and pictures of old Lynchburg hang on the walls. Very friendly staff. I had Fried Green Tomatoes cooked perfectly. They are known for their all day breakfast. Fun place to eat.

data.title: Awesome place!!!!😘😘😘
data.text: Whoah.....this restaurant was fabulous!!! Where do I begin.....first you must try the artichoke spinach cheese dip.....with warm crisp pita bread..... amazing!!! They serve homemade breakfast all day....the salads are fresh with local vegetables....The staff was so friendly and very helpful...husband and I were visiting out of state....chose this restaurant.... recommended by locals.....inside of the restaurant very unique and beautiful....the rolling fans...never seen anything like them.before.... anyways you must eat here...😍😍😍

data.title: OMG good!
data.text: It was so good we ate here twice. Both breakfast and lunch were awesome. They have a lot of craft beers and their dinner menu sounded great, too. Everything made fresh on site. Yum!!  Highly recommend it.

data.title: Old fashion lunchette
data.text: Stopped by this restaurant for some lunch before visiting a client in town and loved it. They offer breakfast all day along and had a wonderful selection. The decor was classic Americana with big fans, friendly staff and delicious food.

data.title: Nice Lunch Stop
data.text: Stoped in for lunch while visiting a few local museums. Large menu selection at reasonable prices. The food was very good.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Excellent food. I got a prime dip sandwich and she got chicken tenders and onion rings. Always fast even though it's busy!

data.title: Would definitely visit again!
data.text: The atmosphere of this place was wonderful.  If you visit, be sure to read the history on the back of the menu.  The breakfast items we had were delicious.  I had, I believe, Eggs Rebecca, and my husband had the biscuits and gravy.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive without hovering.  If you visit Lynchburg, be sure to go have a meal at Market at Main.

data.title: Quaint intetior...   great burgers
data.text:
We stopped in Lynchburg for dinner and this place captured our fancy.  The  server was personable and eager to please, and the manager (?owner) was visible and actively checking with guests.  This is a popular place, judging from the human and traffic.  My husband ordered a burger. And while it didn't come out medium rare, as requested, it was flavorful and juicy...  obviously made with good quality beef.  I ordered shrimp and grits, even though my inner voice was cautioning me about what I was accustomed to on the coast possibly being different from what was served here.  My inner voice was right.  There was plenty on my plate, but it tasted more like thick tomato soup with some very tasty shrimp.

Still though, we would come back...  for burgets!
